business.headline: Rupee falls to all-time low of 86 against US dollarRupee falls to all-time low of 86 against US dollar.

Sensex falls over 600 points: Why is stock market down today? 3 key reasonsStock market today: The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 657.97 points to 76,720.94, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 199.60 points to 23,231.90 as of 9:20 AM.

Stricter US sanctions threaten Russia's oil trade with India and China: Report The new sanctions are likely to severely affect Russia's oil exports, as many tankers previously used for shipments to India and China will now face restrictions.

Standard Glass Lining IPO listing: Shares to make strong market debut? Check GMPStandard Glass Lining share price: The IPO was open for subscription from January 6 to 8, offering shares in a price band of Rs 133-140 with a lot size of 107 shares.

Stocks to watch today: Adani Green Energy, Ola Electric, DMart, HCLTechKey stocks likely to be in focus include Adani Green Energy, Ola Electric, DMart, HCLTech, Angel One, and others due to various announcements, news updates, and quarterly results.

90-hour workweek: What India Inc thinks of L&T chief's suggestionL&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan recently expressed regret over not being able to make employees work on Sundays, suggesting that a 90-hour workweek is key to success.
Union Budget 2025: High hopes as dark clouds loom over economyAmid fears of an economic slowdown, here's what key sectors are demanding from Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman in Union Budget 2025.
Will the stock market recover next week? 4 things you should knowGlobal headwinds and FII outflows weigh on the Sensex and Nifty. Will Dalal Street see a recovery next week after the turbulent run?

Explained: Why Infosys has filed counter lawsuit against CognizantInfosys vs Cognizant legal battle: The Bengaluru-based firm accused its US-based rival of contractually restricting clients from awarding IT services to competitors and withholding software training, which Infosys claims hindered its ability to compete.
High-return FD offers in 2025: SBI, IDBI, Indian Bank, and moreEnhance your savings in 2025 with FD schemes offering up to 8.05% interest, valid until March 31, 2025.

Supreme Court gives big relief for online gaming sector. Details hereThe Supreme Court has stayed Rs 1.12 lakh crore GST notices against online gaming firms, with a final hearing scheduled for March 18, 2025.

Industry leaders call for up to 90-hour workweek. Are they willing to pay more? L&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan made waves by suggesting employees should work on Sundays. Last year, Infosys co-founder Narayana Murthy proposed that millennials work 70-hour weeks to improve India's productivity.
Budget 2025: Don't expect these tax changesBudget 2025 is likely to prioritise fiscal discipline, minor tax tweaks, and cautious consumption boosts over bold reforms.

Rupee hits all-time low, nears 86 mark against US dollarRupee hits all-time: Closing at 85.9650, the rupee marked its tenth consecutive weekly loss, slipping 0.2% this week amid a strong dollar and persistent capital outflows.
Sensex, Nifty close lower amid earnings concerns; TCS gains 6% The S&P BSE Sensex lost 241.30 points to end at 77,378.91, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 95 points to end at 23,431.50.

Explained: Why IRCTC share price jumped up to 5% todayIRCTC share price: The stock rose nearly 5% to hit a day's high of Rs 800.65 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), compared to the previous close of Rs 763.50.
Blinkit launches Bistro app for 10-minute food deliveryBlinkit's Bistro delivers canteen-style food in 10 minutes, rivalling Swiggy's Snacc and Zepto Cafe.

Paytm sees strong institutional growth: Mutual fund stake surges by 3.3%, total holdings up 4%Paytm's progress toward achieving EBITDA before ESOP breakeven by Q4 FY2025 further reinforces its strong fundamentals and appeal to institutional investors.

Budget 2025: Looking back at tax relief measures for senior citizens in 2024Senior citizens seek tax relief and reforms in Budget 2025 to tackle inflation, income challenges and enhance their qulity of life.
GST return filing delayed. Deadline extension expectedGST return filing faces delays due to GSTN portal glitches, with a potential deadline extension expected to ease compliance challenges.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Infra development in J&K unrelated to Article 370 scrapping: Omar AbdullahSpeaking to India Today TV, Chief Minister Omar Abdullah said that completion of infrastructure projects in Jammu and Kashmir has no connection to abrogation of Article 370, adding that they were bound to happen.

Maha Kumbh 2025 begins in Prayagraj, 45 crore devotees expected to attendThe 45-day Maha Kumbh, happening after a gap of 144 years, will witness the participation of over 45 crore devotees, including nearly 15 lakh from foreign nations.
Rupee falls to all-time low of 86 against US dollarRupee falls to all-time low of 86 against US dollar.

Drugged, gang-raped, burned alive: 5 cases reveal horror of UK grooming gangsProbes by counties and reports in the media reveal how grooming gangs run by Pakistani-origin men brutally tortured and gang-raped white girls as young as 11 in the UK. In one case, the victim was burned alive with her sister and mother. Here are five cases that reveal the extent of horror of these grooming gangs in the UK.

Video: Los Angeles man's emotional reunion with dog feared lost amid wildfireA man's desperate days-long search for his beloved dog amid the chaos of the deadly Los Angeles wildfire had a happy ending, as Casey Colvin reunited with Oreo, the pet he feared lost.
Atishi raises over Rs 18 lakh from crowdfunding drive, to file nomination todayDelhi Chief Minister Atishi's crowdfunding campaign garnered support from 422 donors, with Rs 18.56 lakh raised so far.

PM to launch Sonamarg Tunnel in J&K today, Omar Abdullah says will boost tourismPM Modi will reach the Sonamarg Tunnel at 11.45 am for its inauguration. Built at a cost of Rs 2,700 crore, the tunnel will enable the development of Sonamarg resort in Ganderbal district as a winter sports destination.

Video: Bus conductor assaults retired IAS officer over Rs 10 fare in JaipurThe conductor assaulted the retired IAS officer as he refused to pay an additional fare of Rs 10 after he was not dropped at the correct bus stop.

Boney Kapoor's throwback photo with Sridevi is all about true loveProducer Boney Kapoor shared yet another photo of his late wife, legendary actor Sridevi, on Instagram. It received several comments from fans.

24 dead, 12,000 structures destroyed in Los Angeles fire amid race to douse blazeFirefighters raced to control the wildfires in Los Angeles, which has claimed 24 lives so far. Additionally, 16 people have been reported missing amid the ongoing crisis.

India not doing well in Test cricket: New BCCI secretary vows to make changesNewly appointed BCCI secretary Devajit Saikia has vowed to help India return to their best shape in Test cricket. Saikia has acknowledged that India have dropped the ball in Tests in the recent times.

As Trump threatens Canada, Trudeau ex-ally's warning: There will be price to payCanadian MP Jagmeet Singh denounced US President-elect Donald Trump's repeated remarks about Canada becoming America's "51st state."

Watch: Actor Ajith Kumar's cutest message to wife Shalini after Dubai race winActor Ajith Kumar thanked his wife, Shalini, after his team won third place in Dubai 24H race. His cute message for his wife went viral on social media.

Made traitors like him sit at home: Amit Shah's fiery attack on Uddhav ThackerayUnion Home Minister Amit Shah launched a blistering attack on Shiv Sena (UBT) chief Uddhav Thackeray during the BJP's state executive meeting in Shirdi. He criticised Uddhav Thackeray for aligning with the Opposition for the Maharashtra Assembly polls.

Steve Jobs's wife, in India for Maha Kumbh 2025, gets Hindu name 'Kamala'Ahead of her visit to the Maha Kumbh 2025, Laurene Powell Jobs, the wife of late Apple co-founder Steve Jobs, visited Varanasi's Kashi Vishwanath Temple and was given the Hindu name of 'Kamala'.

Miffed at being replaced by Kapil Mishra, Delhi BJP MLA fielded from another seatFive-time BJP MLA Mohan Singh Bisht, who currently represents the Karawal Nagar seat, has been replaced by Kapil Mishra for the upcoming Delhi Assembly elections.

Watch: Anushka Sharma's solo return after Alibaug trip with Virat KohliAnushka Sharma returned to Mumbai alone after a trip to Alibaug with Virat Kohli. The couple was earlier seen at the Gateway of India and Vrindavan.

Pat Cummins to lead as Australia announce 15-member squad for Champions TrophyAustralia have announced their 15-member preliminary squad for the Champions Trophy. Injured fast bowlers Pat Cummins and Josh Hazlewood have been named in the side.

Meghan Markle reschedules Netflix series release due to Los Angeles wildfiresMeghan Markle postponed the premiere of her Netflix series, 'With Love, Meghan' due to wildfires in Los Angeles. Meghan and Prince Harry are supporting the Southern California community after devastating wildfires.

10-men Barcelona thrash Real Madrid 5-2 to win Spanish Super CupFC Barcelona players scored 4 goals in the first half to win their first title of the season. Barcelona beat Real Madrid 5-2 in the final of the Spanish Super Cup.

Students seen cleaning school toilets in viral video, principal suspendedA viral video showing girl students cleaning toilets at a government school in Tamil Nadu's Palakkodu led to the suspension of the principal, pending an official investigation.

Stones thrown at train carrying passengers for Maha Kumbh in MaharashtraThe attack occurred two to three kilometres after the train left the Jalgaon station, causing damage to the windows of the B6 coach.

Arvind Kejriwal called, sought support for AAP for polls, claims Hanuman BeniwalRashtriya Loktantrik Party (RLP) chief MP Hanuman Beniwal said that AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal called him and sought support for AAP for the Delhi elections, adding that he will campaign for the ruling party for the upcoming polls.

After calling Gautam Gambhir hypocrite, Manoj Tiwary blames media for editingFormer India cricketer Manoj Tiwary has issued a clarification, days after calling Gautam Gambhir a hypocrite. Tiwary had lashed out at the India head coach after the team's loss in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

Daaku Maharaaj box office Day 1: Balakrishna's film begins on a strong noteDaaku Maharaaj box office collection Day 1: Nandamuri Balakrishna's Daaku Maharaaj opened its box office run on a strong note. The film earned Rs 22 crore nett in India.

Shreyas Iyer sets sight on winning maiden title for Punjab Kings as captainThe newly appointed captain of the Punjab Kings, Shreyas Iyer, has set his sights on winning maiden title for the franchise in the upcoming IPL 2025.

FA Cup: 10-man Manchester United, Bayindir dump Arsenal out on penaltiesAltay Bayindir was the star of the show as 10-man Manchester United defeated Arsenal 5-3 on penalties to dump them out of the FA Cup in the third round on Sunday, January 12. United fought bravely for most of the game as Diogo Dalot was given a red card.

Pakistan will have upper hand over India in Champions Trophy 2025: Mohammad AmirFormer Pakistan fast bowler Mohammad Amir feels Pakistan will have an upper hand over India in the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 due to their recent form.

Watch: Aryna Sabalenka recreates viral TikTok dance with Melbourne crowdAryna Sabalenka recreated one of her viral TikTok videos with the Melbourne crowd after her first round win in the Australian Open 2025 on Sunday, January 12. Sabalenka defeated Sloanne Stephens in straight sets to make it to the second round.

IPL 2025: Shreyas Iyer to lead Punjab Kings as franchise aims to end barren runPunjab Kings announced India batter Shreyas Iyer as their captain for the Indian Premier League 2025(IPL 2025). Punjab bought Iyer for a whopping Rs 26.75 Crore during the mega auction.

Devajit Saikia delighted to carry forward work done by Jay Shah as BCCI SecretaryThe newly elected BCCI Secretary Devajit Saikia said that he's delighted to carry forward the work done by his predecessor Jay Shah.

PD Champions Trophy: Indian Physical Disability Team beat Pakistan by 109 runsNikhil Manhas was the star of the show as the Indian physical disability team defeated Pakistan by 109 runs on Sunday, January 12. India posted 160 runs in their 19 overs as Pakistan's chase faltered in just 12.2 overs.

Australian Open 2025, Day 2 schedule: Sinner, Djokovic and Alcaraz begin campaignJannik Sinne, Carlos Alcaraz and Novak Djokovic will start their campaign on Day 2 of the Australian Open 2025 on Monday, January 12. Coco Gauff, Iga Swiatek and Naomi Osaka will also be in action on Monday in Melbourne.

IPL to follow ICC's Code of Conduct regulations from 2025 seasonIPL 2025 to align with the ICC's Code of Conduct, enforcing global playing standards for disciplinary actions. Meanwhile, the Women's Premier League will feature matches in Lucknow, Mumbai, Baroda, and Bengaluru, showcasing a landmark season for women's cricket in India.

Australian Open 2025, Day 1: Sabalenka, Zverev progress, Nagal crashes outAryna Sabalenka and Alexander Zverev breezed into the second round of the Australian Open 2025. There was heartbreak for Indian fans as Sumit Nagal crashed out of the competition in the very first round.

Jemimah's hundred helps India clinch ODI series with 116-run victory over IrelandJemimah Rodrigues' maiden international century powered India Women to their highest-ever ODI total of 370/5, securing a dominant 116-run victory over Ireland. With disciplined bowling, India clinched the series 2-0 with one game remaining.

Australian Open: Alexander Zverev breezes past Lucas Pouille to reach Round 2Alexander Zverev made light work of wildcard Lucas Pouille to reach the second round of the Australian Open 2025 on Sunday, January 12. Zverev defeated Pouille in straight sets to make it to the next round in Melbourne.

Afghanistan announce squad for Champions Trophy, Ghazanfar to play maiden ICC eventAfghanistan Cricket Board (ACB) have announced a 15-member squad for the ICC Champions Trophy 2025. AM Ghazanfar is all set to play his maiden ICC tournament while Mujeeb ur Rahman has missed out on selection.

WPL 2025 to be hosted in Mumbai, Vadodara, Lucknow and Bengaluru: Rajeev ShuklaThe WPL 2025 will be held across 4 cities, BCCI vice-president Rajeev Shukla confirmed on Sunday, January 12. Mumbai, Lucknow, Bengaluru and Vadodara will act as the venues for the women's franchise league this year.

Neuer confirms Bayern Munich contract extension till 2026: It's trueManuel Neuer, Bayern Munich's legendary goalkeeper, will extend his contract until 2026, adapting to a new role with reduced salary, performance-based incentives, and a mentorship responsibility to prepare his future successor for the club's long-term success.

Champions Trophy squad meeting on 18-19 Jan, IPL dates confirmed: Rajeev ShuklaBCCI vice-president Rajeev Shukla has revealed that the meeting for deciding the Champions Trophy squad will happen during 18-19 January. Mr. Shukla also revealed that IPL 2025 will start from March 21, with the final being played on May 25.

Watch: Novak Djokovic attends BBL at MCG, shocked after Stoinis' dismissalNovak Djokovic witnessed a thrilling Melbourne Derby at the BBL, where Marcus Stoinis' bizarre dismissal left the crowd and Djokovic stunned. Glenn Maxwell's explosive 90 lifted the Stars.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
